poem:
"Verse of the Absurd Pantomime"

In the hollow barn of politics,  
Voices echo, grievances and tricks.  
Even the raven mocks in disdain,  
Upon each new scandal's fresh stain.  
Justice wearily limps in shadows dense,  
Probes truth or facades of pretense?  
The world's stage clammed in disarray,  
Numb amid the incessant fray.  
An empire's robe, stained, threadbare,  
On which figure wears it do we dare to care?
